item.title: Denoising Diffusion Models Part 1: Estimating True Distribution
item.description: What are Denoising Diffusion Models? Denoising Diffusion Models, commonly referred to as “Diffusion models”, are a class of generative models based on the Variational Auto Encoder (VAE) architecture. These models are called likelihood-based models because they assign a high likelihood to the observed data samples. In contrast to other generative models, such as GANs, which learn the sampling process of a complex distribution and are trained adversarially. These models are currently the State of the art for Image generation.
